thread.title: Manchester United's 16-game unbeaten run of no interest to Jose Mourinho ahead of Stoke trip
thread.title_full: Manchester United's 16-game unbeaten run of no interest to Jose Mourinho ahead of Stoke trip

author: David Anderson
title: Manchester United's 16-game unbeaten run of no interest to Jose Mourinho ahead of Stoke trip
text:
Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jose Mourinho claims he does not care about Manchester United’s 16-game unbeaten run. 
They last lost on November 3 at Fenerbahce in the Europa League and are on their best sequence since clocking up 18 matches without defeat in Sir Alex Ferguson’s final season. 
But Mourinho does not want his players to become fixated by it and to go to Stoke today with a mindset of just trying not to lose. 
“I don’t care about the unbeaten run,” said the Reds boss. “We’re not going to play any match simply to try to be unbeaten for one more match, or to try and reach 18 or to try and reach 20, not at all. 
“We want to win matches, we try to win matches, we risk to win matches. If we lose, we lose and we lose the unbeaten run. But we’re not going to Stoke to defend our very nice unbeaten run.” Mourinho is delighted by Fellaini's form this year (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) Read More Transfer news LIVE: All the latest from the January window 
Mourinho’s focus is another win to stay in the Champions League hunt and he is pleased to see Marouane Fellaini has silenced his critics. 
Fellaini has had a tempestuous relationship with United fans because he was a David Moyes signing and is viewed as a long-ball player. The Belgium midfielder was targeted again after conceding a costly penalty at Everton last month, but scored against Hull 11 days ago. 
“I think they turned back in his favour after he went back to good performances,” said Mourinho. 
“He’s showing great character and the fans are showing great respect and great knowledge about his contribution. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
